metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14177 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
Apport through 2.20.7 does not properly handle core dumps from setuid binaries allowing local users to create certain files as root which an attacker could leverage to perform a denial of service via resource exhaustion or possibly gain root privileges.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2015-1324.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.12
apport-gtk - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.12
apport-kde - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.12
apport-noui - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.12
apport-retrace - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.12
apport-valgrind - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.12
dh-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.12
python-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.12
python-problem-report - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.12
python3-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.12
python3-problem-report - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-0ubuntu2.12').
